Package camzup.pfriendly

Class ZImage

java.lang.Object
processing.core.PImage
camzup.pfriendly.ZImage
All Implemented Interfaces:
Cloneable, processing.core.PConstants
public class ZImage extends processing.core.PImage
An extension of PImage, specializing in color gradients and blitting text to an image.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    static final int
    CHECKER_DARK
    Default color for dark checker squares, -11184811 or 1.0 / 3.0 of 255.
    static final int
    CHECKER_LIGHT
    Default color for light checker squares, -5592406 or 2.0 / 3.0 of 255.
    static final int
    DEFAULT_ALIGN
    Default horizontal alignment when creating an image from text: PConstants.LEFT, 37.
    static final int
    DEFAULT_KERNING
    Default spacing between characters, in pixels, when creating an image from text: 0.
    static final int
    DEFAULT_LEADING
    Default spacing between lines, in pixels, when creating an image from text: 8.

    ALPHA_MASK, BLUE_MASK, format, GREEN_MASK, height, loaded, parent, pixelDensity, pixelHeight, pixels, pixelWidth, RED_MASK, width

    • adjustAlpha

      public static processing.core.PImage adjustAlpha(processing.core.PImage source, int alpha, processing.core.PImage target)
      Multiplies the alpha channel of each pixel in an array by the supplied alpha value. Changes the image format to PConstants.ARGB. Depending on the renderer, the image may need adjustment with premul(PImage, PImage) and unpremul(PImage, PImage).
      Parameters:
      source - the source image
      alpha - the alpha scalar
      target - the target image
      Returns:
      the translucent image

      public static processing.core.PImage blend(processing.core.PImage a, float ax, float ay, processing.core.PImage b, float bx, float by, processing.core.PImage target, Vec2 tl)
      Blends backdrop and overlay images. Forms a union of the bounding area of the two inputs. Emits the top-left corner for the union. Rounds the offsets to integers.

      ax - backdrop x offset
      ay - backdrop y offset
      b - overlay image
      bx - overlay x offset
      by - overlay y offset
      target - target image
      tl - top left
      Returns:
      the blended pixels

    • blur

      public static processing.core.PImage blur(processing.core.PImage source, int step, processing.core.PImage target)
      Blurs an image by averaging each color with its neighbors in 8 directions. The step determines the size of the kernel, where the minimum step of 1 will make a 3x3, 9 pixel kernel.

      source - the source image
      step - the kernel step
      target - the target image
      Returns:
      the blurred image

    • fromText

      public static processing.core.PImage fromText(processing.core.PFont font, String text, Color fillClr, int leading, int kerning, int textAlign)
      Blits glyph images from a PFont onto a single image. The leading and kerning are measured in pixels; negative values are not allowed. The horizontal text alignment may be either center PConstants.CENTER ( 3 ), right PConstants.RIGHT ( 39 ) or left PConstants.LEFT ( 37 ).

      Images created with this method do not have a reference to a parent PApplet.
      Parameters:
      font - the Processing font
      text - the string of text
      fillClr - the color
      leading - spacing between lines
      kerning - spacing between characters
      textAlign - the horizontal alignment
      Returns:
      the new image

      Generates a radial gradient from an origin point. The origin should be in the range [-1.0, 1.0]. Does not account for aspect ratio, so an image that isn't 1:1 will result in an ellipsoid.

    • mask

      public static processing.core.PImage mask(processing.core.PImage a, float ax, float ay, processing.core.PImage b, float bx, float by, processing.core.PImage target, Vec2 tl)
      Masks a backdrop image with an overlay. Forms an intersection of the bounding area of the two inputs. Emits the top-left corner for the intersection.

      ax - backdrop x offset
      ay - backdrop y offset
      b - overlay image
      bx - overlay x offset
      by - overlay y offset
      target - target image
      tl - top left
      Returns:
      the blended pixels

    • mirror

      public static processing.core.PImage mirror(processing.core.PImage source, float xOrig, float yOrig, float xDest, float yDest, boolean flip, processing.core.PImage target)
      Mirrors an image across the axis described by an origin and destination. Coordinates are expected to be in the range [-1.0, 1.0]. Out-of-bounds pixels are omitted from the mirror.
      Parameters:
      source - the source image
      xOrig - the origin x
      yOrig - the origin y
      xDest - the destination x
      yDest - the destination y
      flip - the flip reflection flag
      target - the output image
      Returns:
      the mirrored image
      See Also:
      • Pixels.mirror(int[], int, int, float, float, float, float, boolean, int[])

    • paletteExtract

      public static Color[] paletteExtract(processing.core.PImage source, int capacity)
      Extracts a palette from an image with an octree in CIE LAB. The size of the palette depends on the capacity of each node in the octree. Does not retain alpha component of image pixels. Colors produced may not be in gamut.
      Parameters:
      source - the source image
      capacity - the octree capacity
      Returns:
      the color array

    • paletteExtract

      public static Color[] paletteExtract(processing.core.PImage source, int capacity, int threshold)
      Extracts a palette from an image with an octree in CIE LAB. The size of the palette depends on the capacity of each node in the octree. Does not retain alpha component of image pixels. The threshold describes the minimum number of unique colors in the image beneath which it is preferable to not engage the octree. Once the octree has been used, colors produced may not be in gamut.
      Parameters:
      source - the source image
      capacity - the octree capacity
      threshold - the minimum threshold
      Returns:
      the color array

      palette - the color palette
      capacity - the octree capacity
      radius - the query radius
      target - the target image
      Returns:
      the mapped image
      See Also:
      • Pixels.paletteMap(int[], Color[], int, float, int[])

    • stretchContrast

      public static processing.core.PImage stretchContrast(processing.core.PImage source, float fac, processing.core.PImage target)
      Finds the minimum, maximum and mean lightness in a source image. If factor is positive, stretches color to maximum lightness range in [0.0, 100.0]. If factor is negative, compresses color to mean. Assigns result to target array. The factor is expected to be in [-1.0, 1.0].

      If difference between minimum and maximum lightness is negligible, copies source array to target.
      Parameters:
      source - the source image
      fac - the factor
      target - the target image
      Returns:
      the normalized image
      See Also:
      • Pixels.stretchContrast(int[], float, int[])

    • stretchContrast

      public static processing.core.PImage stretchContrast(processing.core.PImage source, processing.core.PImage target)
      Finds the minimum and maximum lightness in a source image. If difference between minimum and maximum lightness is negligible, copies source array to target.
      Parameters:
      source - the source image
      target - the target image
      Returns:
      the normalized image

    • wrap

      public static processing.core.PImage wrap(processing.core.PImage source, int dx, int dy, processing.core.PImage target)
      Blits a source image's pixels onto a target image's pixels, using integer floor modulo to wrap the source image. The source image can be offset horizontally and/or vertically, creating the illusion of parallax.
      Parameters:
      source - the source image
      dx - horizontal pixel offset
      dy - vertical pixel offset
      target - the target image
      Returns:
      the image
      See Also:
      • Pixels.wrap(int[], int, int, int, int, int, int[])
